reviewText:
Rating: 6/10
Overview: First Person Shooter
Similiar Games: Doom


The Good:

+ On a technical level, the graphics are decent, lighting effects look good

+ Lots of weapons that can be upgraded by finding money

+ Weapons feel very satisfying

+ Survival and horde modes add to the replayability


The Average:

Mash the 'use' buttom to open up lockers...


The Bad:

- Every level looks identical, very little changes in the environment making every level feel the same

- Gameplay can be very repetitive, shoot down hordes of zombies, enter the next room, shoot down hords of zombies....etc.

- Terrible voice acting and story.

Conclusion:

One of the few games I'm willing to give a positive rating despite the low score. I am sympathetic towards indie developers, obvoiusly they don't have the budget or man power to compete at the same level as other studios. Is this a bad game? If you compare it to major games like Doom than yes, however if you keep your expectations in check and realize you are playing a fun distraction with a minimal budget it isn't all that bad.

reviewText:
This is honestly maybe the 2nd worst game I've played this year. It is so bad. It is unbelievably bad. I can't believe how bad it is. The amount of anger I have experienced playing it is phenomenal. I don't even know how to describe this game other than say that all it is is watching reload animations. It takes approximately 3 seconds to unload an entire clip. It takes 3.5 seconds to reload. That means you are spending more than half your gun action reloading. And usually when you are reloading there are a dozen or so zombies around you. I hate this game. I really honestly hate this game. I have reloaded so many times...

Maybe I never got the guns that might make this game fun. But you need currency to get better guns and every time you die in this game it costs you currency, and you die so much because your guns are so crappy that you never have neough currency to get better ones. You have to play the game to get currency, but when playing you die, and lose all your currency, so basically there is no reason to play the game. The game actually doesn't want you to play it. That's what I inferred from it anyway.

It's horrible. Don't buy it. Don't play it. I want it removed from my Steam library. I don't even want a refund or anything. I just want it removed.

reviewText: At first, I thought that this game was an impossible horror story..........Then I made some adjustments, and learned to use a few tricks, and now I find that it's quite playable . ........... ADJUSTMENTS - I don't have an NVIDEA graphics driver on my little laptop, so the game ran somewhat shakey and surreal, untill I turned 1. VISUAL QUALITY 2. SHADER QUALITY and 3. EFFECT QUALITY down to the MEDIUM SETTING, and the game still looks just fine to me, and runs smooth . (What V-Sync, Antialiasing, and Anisotrophy is or does I'm not sure, but I don't think that I touched on those in the video opions .) ............. TRICKS - I originally replayed level one about ten times, to earn enough space zombie bucks to beef up my hot girly's shotgun, but then I found that I didn't need to do that . When I press the right bumper button, on my gamepad controller BOOM !!!!! All the zombies around me suffer exploding heads, which is a great way to get out of a zombie bum rush, then keep going in and out with the stun gun (you don't have to shoot heads), and you'll gradually be able to pick off most of them as they come in and you back up . Just get the rhythm down for recharging of the basic stun - about five seconds, and the head explosion thing - about two minutes . Also, take out the gun turrets with your hand grenades . Zombies with hand grenades get hand grenades .

reviewText:
A guilty pleasure.

The mechanics are rudimentary, the level design and story are enthusiastically cliched, the monster variety does not sufficiently escalate, and I defeted the final boss with four crossbow shots. The flashlight is underused to the point that you only need to turn it on in the tutorial section that it's introduced.

Despite this, I thoroughly enjoyed it and will be playing through it again on the plus mode. It reminds me of Alien Shooter 2 in its gleeful cheapness.

reviewText:
Dead Effect is a first-person, arena based zombie shooter. In other words, it’s a whole lot of fun! However, the respawn system is terrible but encourages you to not die or to not be stupid or whatever. So basically, it’s a fun game with a crappy respawn system but the awful respawn system isn’t enough to break the game or to not recommend.

In other words, I do recommend buying this game but that respawn system is terrible. Pro tip: just don’t suck and respawning won’t be a big deal. The end.

reviewText:
I never played this game until I happened to purchase it in a random bundle of steam keys, but I am glad I managed to stumble across it!

Yes, the game isn't very innovative or even interesting as far as the story goes, but the gameplay is really engaging for a first-person shooter and that's what really matters here. The weapons are pretty standard fare, but manage to be fun -- especially the electrical shock glove that you get at the very beginning.

If you like first-person shooters and zombie games, then this one is certainly worth giving a try. It can be very difficult at times, but the longer you play the more upgrades you get and the easier it gets to really lay into the zombie hordes looking to tear you apart.

reviewText: Great game so far, only on maybe the 3rd level but still a great game. Only things that are missing is a melee attack, jumping and hand to hand combat weapons :). Yea you get a arm tazer but honestly in a hoard of zombies its damn near suicide. A baseball bat, crowbar or something would have been alot better. Other then that its all around fun. A little of dead space mixed with resident evil and maybe COD lol. Was a bit disappointed that there was no intro story movie and not sure if there even are any. That's always a big thing for me, great movie clips to dig you into the role of the character and give you more background info on your current situation. Yea being thrown into the game without a clue is often fun and exciting too while you piece together the story. That's what this one seems like so far.  A definite must have for any game library.

reviewText:
Pros:
-Nice looking ship, though gets pretty generic and nothing really pops after a few missions
-Killing lots of zombies is fun for a while
-I am a fan of bad voice acting so ill count it cause its funny.
-Seems to run well for an Early access game.
-Like the Doom style when you complete zones, dunno why.  Maybe I'm old.

Cons:
-Gets boring fast.  Guns and abilities are nothing really new or innovative.  Upgrade system is same old same old
-Horrible click a button dodge boss attack stuff. gross
-Missions are dull. Nothing at all new that isnt in a million other games. ie turn off evil gas, find pass codes, get to the medical center etc.
-The game itself is just insanely easy even on harder modes.
-Bodies vapirize into thin air, I hate when games do this.
-Stuff you find is not interesting, the PDAs that could give you some story or immersion don't really do anything cept get you 1/7 found, yay?

Its definately not terrible, but there really is not anything special about it.  Pretty straightforward and generic.

reviewText:
Well...that was interesting.  The game is very low budget.  I guess I will do a pro/con thing because I am really torn about it.

Pro:
Good lighting and sound effects
Good weapons, they feel useful and powerful especially on power up.
Cheap...think I paid $5 on steam sale.

Cons:
Freakishly short...about 10 hours MAX.
The same level, with the same graphics over and over and.....over again.
Overall graphics repeated so many times it looks like a few college kids made the game in their spare time.  Which they might have for all I know.
Voice acting...the worst of any game I have ever played and I have been gaming for 25 years.  I played the girl...and yea, it's that bad.  My favorite is when you run as the girl you get the man's" heavy breathing voice.  Classic.
Nothing to interact with...except a twitch hack screen to get through a door.  That's it.  Everything else is for show.
Nothing to blow up.  Heck
date: FEAR was blowing up objects 8 year's ago and Half-Life was doing it 13 years ago.\n\nIn summary
recommended: the game is a simple twitch shooter which if you pay more than $5...you paid to much.  The end."
hoursPlayed: January 5, 2015

reviewText: Alright so this is my first review. I have played this game extensively and found many things. The game has or had great potential to be something good. I feel as though the game was half finished then abandoned after the developers made enough money for a sequel. My heart bleeds for games that coulda been great. It had an ok story, decent graphics that were optimized fairly well so that you didnt need an super high tech PC build to run it, and some good content, but it fell short after I found out the announcement of the sequel. The negatives of the game is. Clunky cutscenes, controls, gameplay, eventually after you exhaust the content of the game it sorta just sits in your steam for years collecting dust, and the ending was not fullfiling at all. Even though the story was predictable I found it likeable in a way. I also noticed that at some point possibly the game might have been being designed to be a horror game, but was hastely changed to an action shooter. I will admit it had great horror potential. Amazing in fact! If it was done properly and finished I could totally see this game being worth much more. As it stands now I would not recommend this game much to many. If your looking for a good quick game thrill then I guess this game is for you.

reviewText:
What a fascinatingly awful game. I bought this because of the postive reviews and this is just strange.  The whole thing is so completely devoid of anything interesting at all.  As a concept, it seems amusingly mediocre. Guns + zombies + space station looking corridors. What could go wrong? Well everything apparently.

This is a port of a mobile game (which I should have known) so it has a weird pace to it that is instantly recognizable as such.  The combat promotes a limited range of movement due to the fact that aiming and walking around with a touch screen is quite difficult. When you throw a mouse and keyboard into the mix the whole situation is almost comical. You just end up picking off big groups of exteremely slow moving zombies by effortlessly shooting them one by one in the face, moving back a bit, and then repeating the process.

I wouldn't recommend this to anyone. It should not have been sold as a PC game. Period.

reviewText:

Beat first level in story mode
Go to the Biohazard mode to grind some gold

Upgrade those weapons to maximum
Equip those weapons in story mode
Beat the main story with those weapons
Delete game
Play something else

It's a bit booring

You can't jump, which is frustrating.
Not enough variation in waves in Biohazard mode. (I didn't try the other mode)
Not enough variation in monsters. I count 9 different" kinds of monsters"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As early access goes, this one's got a strong base. I'll be updating this review as I play through more of the game; all of this is gathered from the first mission.

1. Game feels strictly like a mobile port in many ways. You can't yet use the escape key to back out of menus, there's no explanation of controls, and the presence of giant circular icons clearly denotes something that would have been tapped on a mobile device. The last only became a problem for me in one place: unlocking chests / lockers / whatever those were. You just mash E a few times while the screen shakes for no explained reason, and they're unlocked... There also is no ability to modify controls, at least from within the game (mentioned by StarSepp in comments of this review). Doesn't look like there's any config to edit the controls, either.

2. It took six or more headshots to kill a zombie in the first level, the variety in the radioactive yellow suit. Why?

3. I can't jump what is this WHAT IS THIS

4. Scrolling through weapons causes me to throw waste grenades.

5. Text within some of the logs / items on screen bleeds through the perimiter of its textbox and looks ugly. Easy to fix with a scrollbar.

Overall the game needs heavy work and probably shouldn't be available yet.

reviewText:
So lets start off with the fact that it obviously looks like an fps Dead Space which we all know is a great idea. and with a price of $5 it makes it just that much more appealing. so obviously i bought it. as you can see i only clocked in a little less than 2 hours on this at the time of this review being written and believe me ill add more to it. I personally think this game is great. the weapons you can buy(a little too pricey for how common credits are but what are ya gonna do...) are really bad ♥♥♥ and make this slightly stiff shooter so much better. The Power glove weapon thing you start out with is very usefull and makes you add diversity to your kills with its very helpful pulse explosion and a high damage percise tazer like attack that really saves you in tight spots. i dont know if this is trying to be scary all around but the atmosphere that was used in Dead Space 1 resembles this very much but with a lack of audio(Background noises that keep you aware of the horrors around the next corner) to in a way make the rusty broken down space station seem scary... if youve read this far i think that youd love to hear about the guy that talks to you over that radio being some dude trying to sound like Arnold which is just icing on the cake that is this game. WARNING This is single player and i dont think it matters on steam but this is an M Rated style game with bloot and violence that certain parents may not find suitible for children to play
8.5/10

reviewText:
It's been said, but this game is an old school shooter. Straight run and gun, blast everything, kill everything that moves, period. On that level, it succeeds.

I'm not going to be too harsh on it since i bought it on sale for $1.49. However, there are problems. The audio sliders don't seem to be doing anything for me. While the voice acting is pretty awful, and gameplay is linear, it would be nice to be able to hear what's going on but i can't since i the music is so loud. The graphics are mediocre, but get the job done. Oh yeah, the voice acting is terrible, the storyline is pretty shallow and there are silly quick time sequences.

This game also hates triple screen, and unlike most games i have, this game will not use a single screen when i turn it down to 1920x1080. Instead, it stretches the 1920 across all three screens. Not cool. Really, the only problem i've run across in triple screen is that the tablets are unusable. Once i pick one up to read it, it gets stretched to unreadable proportions and i can't get out of it. I have to ctrl-alt-del and end the program. I'm guessing there are buttons i'm supposed to click. Maybe i'll disable my screen grouping, or maybe i'll just finish the game without bothering to read the tablets.

But forget all that and buy it anyway. It's a quick and dirty, zombies in space, sci-fi fps. The controls are crisp and responsive. No realistic anything to get in the way. It's a blast from the past kind of game and i love it for that.

reviewText:
In space... noone can see you jump.

The idea is fine, and it's a fair port of a mobile game, but there are too many flaws. It doesn't allow much variance in play style, and you can't even jump. The first weapon you get is a shock weapon. If you run out of ammo and need to rely on the shock weapon, you might as well restart the mission because you're most likely already dead. The lack of checkpoints is also rather annoying. If you die or need to quit in the middle of a mission, even one room away from completion, you have to start all over again.

The voice acting is bad to the point of being funny, so that's kind of a plus. The biggest advantage was that I got some cards to sell.

Some might like the game, but I wouldn't suggest it... unless maybe if it's on sale... a good sale, not just 10% off.

reviewText:
I'm going to make this really simple.

If you're expecting a revolutionary game that comes to you with new ideas, mechanics, gameplay, a compelling story, phenomenal gunplay, expert voice acting and next generation graphics... This is totally not that game. However, if you're looking for a shooter you can waste your time on and not feel completely compelled to listen to the story, and can enjoy some different game modes in and just kill some monsters. This game is perfect for you.

The game is a horror shooter and it does this well. The atmosphere is epic and probably the greatest feature of the game.

The graphics are pretty on par with most other games of this style if not better, with some lower resolution textures in some places, but really not bad for the first game from a new company.

The story is pretty meh, and the voice acting is terrible. But lets be honest, you're not really buying it for that.

The gunplay doesn't really stand out as anything special, it's just average and works as you'd expect it to.

On a whole, I'd say this game is really average, there's nothing new here, but it's fun. I recommend it because it's priced to sell as an average game. I picked it up on sale for cheap and it's completely worth it. I would have probably paid the full price for it. This was probably intended to generate a bit of revenue for a new company to build something bigger, I believe they successfully did a good job releasing a product that's priced correctly to raise money for possible future projects, and also something that will give the customers value for their money.

reviewText:
So lets start off with the fact that it obviously looks like an fps Dead Space which we all know is a great idea. and with a price of $5 it makes it just that much more appealing. so obviously i bought it. as you can see i only clocked in a little less than 2 hours on this at the time of this review being written and believe me ill add more to it. I personally think this game is great. the weapons you can buy(a little too pricey for how common credits are but what are ya gonna do...) are really bad ♥♥♥ and make this slightly stiff shooter so much better. The Power glove weapon thing you start out with is very usefull and makes you add diversity to your kills with its very helpful pulse explosion and a high damage percise tazer like attack that really saves you in tight spots. i dont know if this is trying to be scary all around but the atmosphere that was used in Dead Space 1 resembles this very much but with a lack of audio(Background noises that keep you aware of the horrors around the next corner) to in a way make the rusty broken down space station seem scary... if youve read this far i think that youd love to hear about the guy that talks to you over that radio being some dude trying to sound like Arnold which is just icing on the cake that is this game. WARNING This is single player and i dont think it matters on steam but this is an M Rated style game with bloot and violence that certain parents may not find suitible for children to play
8.5/10

reviewText:
It's been said, but this game is an old school shooter. Straight run and gun, blast everything, kill everything that moves, period. On that level, it succeeds.

I'm not going to be too harsh on it since i bought it on sale for $1.49. However, there are problems. The audio sliders don't seem to be doing anything for me. While the voice acting is pretty awful, and gameplay is linear, it would be nice to be able to hear what's going on but i can't since i the music is so loud. The graphics are mediocre, but get the job done. Oh yeah, the voice acting is terrible, the storyline is pretty shallow and there are silly quick time sequences.

This game also hates triple screen, and unlike most games i have, this game will not use a single screen when i turn it down to 1920x1080. Instead, it stretches the 1920 across all three screens. Not cool. Really, the only problem i've run across in triple screen is that the tablets are unusable. Once i pick one up to read it, it gets stretched to unreadable proportions and i can't get out of it. I have to ctrl-alt-del and end the program. I'm guessing there are buttons i'm supposed to click. Maybe i'll disable my screen grouping, or maybe i'll just finish the game without bothering to read the tablets.

But forget all that and buy it anyway. It's a quick and dirty, zombies in space, sci-fi fps. The controls are crisp and responsive. No realistic anything to get in the way. It's a blast from the past kind of game and i love it for that.

reviewText:
First off, this game was a blast! I've played a couple of first person shooters before on the pc and Dead Effect wasn't that bad in comparison. The screen lagged for me a few times but nothing that deterred me from keep playing the game.

The powers the game gives you are nice but you would think that they were unnecessary except to make things look cool as you obliterate hordes of zombies while you fire on them in bullet time but I was proven wrong when I had to use them in certain areas of the game that requires you to use them no matter how much of a crack shot you are. Though they tend to feel Overpowered at times, especially at boss fights.

Bullet time > Empty mag on boss > Reload and repeat if you have time > Rinse and repeat. A little underwhelming once you understand their attack patterns. Then again, I haven't tried hard mode yet so I can't claim any bragging rights on that.

The story isn't that grandiose in comparison to a few other games out there but then again, I'm here to shoot zombies not listen to a story. Still, if you have the patience to take the time and seek out the tidbits of story background, you'll find it quite engaging...provided you aren't busy shooting at zombies that is.

Also, final boss fight, so silly at the end. Buy the game to find out why ;)

reviewText:
Doom III clone with zombies instead of demons, a survival-mode and upgrading options.
The game is graphicly nearly identical to Doom III, nothing esceptional to note.
The sound is nothing exceptional either, though the awfull voice-work must be mentioned.
Gameplay-wise it's just arcade-shooting fun, with your gathered money you can upgrade your character and weapons.
There some secrets to look for during missions and lore-stuff to unlock.
About 14 missions of each around an hour to shoot trough and a survival-mode to keep you engaged.
Simple fun for €4,99 you really can't complain, but it isn't a 'must-buy' game either.

reviewText:
A quick,mindless and decently fun sci-fi shooter,originally made for mobiles.

Pros:

-graphics are decent,textures scale up well,models aren't bad.

-pretty old school gameplay,shoot hordes of things trying to not get overwhelmed,also bullet time and an aoe move.

-decent selection of weapons,all upgreadable.

-a few extra gamemodes and a new game + for those so inclined.

Cons:

-some graphic effects are subpar,also reused assets which make the levels look quite same-ish in the long run.

-sound is generally poor,the voice acting is embarassing overall.

-some difficulty spikes and unfair deaths.

-weapon reloading time is generally long,and it seems to just be a gimmick to artificially increase the game difficulty.

-the overall gold/credits upgrade system,and the fact you use credits to respawn if you die seems out of place in a PC game.

Overall this is a mindless fun and simple game which I think is worth its price when on sale (I got it for less than 2$),think of it as a very light Doom experience with lower production values.

reviewText: Though originally made for tablets and and smartphone, Dead Effect is a good port of a decent game. Voices are a little muddled at times, but gameplay is good, and the high number of weapons and play modes has a decent amount of replay value. There's enough story to make it interesting, although the voices leave something to be desired. Overall, this is one of the better shooters, and would recommend this one to others. My only complaints at this time is that gold is cumbersome to collect, though thankfully not very necessary currency except for a few items, and those damn grenade zombies.

reviewText:
This review is based on:
Story mode almost completed

Gameplay
The gameplay is basically, kill zombies, find money and ammo around the map, buy/upgrade weapons, kill more zombies.
The zombies themselves aren’t a threat with the only exception of the grenade user which launch explosives that are almost impossible to dodge unless you are on an open space, and even worse, they kill you instantly even at full health.
There is also a shop where you buy and upgrade weapons and resupply ammo/grenades with either in-game dollars or golden bars which are randomly found by killing enemies.

Story
The story is, well, kinda simple, you are a space guy or girl who wake up in a ship where something went terribly wrong and it’s now filled with zombies

Sound
The sound effects are ok (except for the fact that both male and female soldiers share the same breathing sound effect which clearly sounds male), the music is bland and repetitive and the VA goes between being good and being horrible

Graphics & optimization
Graphics are quite mediocre like a game from early last gen and it’s clearly a phone game  but it runs surprisingly well, with some bugs here and there (once I’ve fallen trough the floor onto oblivion for no reason)

Conclusion
I don't really recommend this unless you are in need of a FPS, totally not recommended at full price

Vote 6/10

reviewText: I don't get why people are so hard on these indie dev games, they aren't meant to be AAA quality, they're made by a group of people not a billion dollar company. If you say it's ♥♥♥♥ because of bugs, every game would be ♥♥♥♥ in your eyes, there is not one game that hasn't had bugs at some point. I really think this game is great, it may not be the most original game out there, but it's a fun game none the less. Whatever happened to people playing games for the fun of it, now it's all about which game has the best graphics, and which game has the least bugs, no one cares for fun anymore. When people look at these games they don't look at what's good in the game, they spen about 9/10s of their gameplay time looking for bugs, or critisizing how the game looks. Yeah, I know games that are coming out now adays are choppy and rushed, even the AAA titles, but these guys/gals worked hard, and they are still working hard, give them a break. It is a fun game, I enjoyed the time I spent playing it, I didn't look at the graphics or the animations, I was looking for something fun to do in my spare time, and this game was good for that, I played it, had fun, and moved on to the next title. No this game isn't perfect, but it isn't unplayable and it is very much possible to play it and have fun whilst doing so.

reviewText:
A cheap and extremly fun zombie FPS with the best dynamic weapon sounds i've ever heard.

Pros:
- Gameplay is laughably good. Sometimes hard, sometimes messy.
- Weapons and the upgrade system is questionably good. Why other games (even AAAs) cannot have such goodness? Upgrades really do something.
- Weapon sounds are atrociously perfect.
- The shotguns are sooooooo satisfying weapons it's hard to believe.
- Never thought that in a cheap indy space zombie FPS i will find the best bow simulator. F**** enjoyable!

Cons:
-Graphic is strangely oldish. I saw last time these metalish looking humans in Necrovision games.

8/10 - Hard to believe good zombie FPS with near perfect weapon ssystem and absolutely perfect weapon sounds.

reviewText:
I thought to myself, I'll give this game a chance. It was a whopping 1.50 on sale so wasn't going to be a huge loss even if the game was atrocious. Even after reading the Rock / Paper / Shotgun review which basically nailed this game to a cross saying it was unimaginative and terrible, I ignored it, digging deep to plunder through this game and see if it brought anything new to the table. I was wrong.

Problem One - Doesn't matter which character your playing, the voice acting is beyond terrible. There is literally no emotion in anything either one says and everything is said in a cool and calm manner.

Problem Two - Head shots kill everything. Lurching zombies and retextured/ reskinned zombies over and over again.

Problem Three - Imaginary upgrade shop from credits and gold bars?

I could go on with the things that annoy me about this game, but this is all I'm willing to give it. 1/5. Brought nothing new to the table and is, by my standards, a waste of time.

reviewText: I don't get why people are so hard on these indie dev games, they aren't meant to be AAA quality, they're made by a group of people not a billion dollar company. If you say it's ♥♥♥♥ because of bugs, every game would be ♥♥♥♥ in your eyes, there is not one game that hasn't had bugs at some point. I really think this game is great, it may not be the most original game out there, but it's a fun game none the less. Whatever happened to people playing games for the fun of it, now it's all about which game has the best graphics, and which game has the least bugs, no one cares for fun anymore. When people look at these games they don't look at what's good in the game, they spen about 9/10s of their gameplay time looking for bugs, or critisizing how the game looks. Yeah, I know games that are coming out now adays are choppy and rushed, even the AAA titles, but these guys/gals worked hard, and they are still working hard, give them a break. It is a fun game, I enjoyed the time I spent playing it, I didn't look at the graphics or the animations, I was looking for something fun to do in my spare time, and this game was good for that, I played it, had fun, and moved on to the next title. No this game isn't perfect, but it isn't unplayable and it is very much possible to play it and have fun whilst doing so.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Makes a startlingly good first impression, and it's pretty good value for your money. If your value your time more than your money, though, I can't recommend Dead Effect. Everything about it is perfectly serviceable, and kind of impressive for what appears to be a budget game, but it doesn't do anything particularly well. There's a lot to it - a story mode (complete with some of the most endearingly bad voice-acting I've ever heard), different survival modes, and a decent variety of weapons/equipment you can unlock with in-game currency that you grind out in the various modes.

Basically, for everything that Dead Effect does, there's another game that does that thing better. Dead Space, Killing Floor, maybe Doom? All of those are going to be more rewarding. Dead Effect is mediocre in the purest sense of the word - it's not bad, but it's not good, either.

SUMMARY: Good value for your money, but your time would be better spent elsewhere.

reviewText:
A very good game. Graphics are likeable, plot is not that silly after all, single player campaign is a bit short, but there are additional modes like Survival, Biohazard (kill X enemy waves) and you can repeat single missions.

Interesting things - at later levels you can upgrade your suit through several upgrade stations (1 point each). Interesting enough, those points are permanent - you get the advantage in all game modes.

Guns are nice, minigun is probably the best one. There is a small hole in the desing (I think) - basically when you have upgraded your suit a bit and improved your main weapon to the point that it can shoot and reload fast, then you can repeatedly do first biohazard mission for cash and gold and thus in about an hour you can afford like most of weapons that are available.

There is also a New Game Plus or whatever it's called - basically, a new game on a bit higher difficulty, where you have all you've got in a previous playthrough.

I do recommend this shooter, it's very good, pace is great, tons of fun.

___

One guy noticed that one type of enemy took all of his fun from this game. Well, soldiers with grenades are a bit pain in the back, but still this a shooter where player should react quickly. But after all - you can upgrade your health and after one or two upgrades you can withstand one grenade. Also try to save gold for autohealing, it really helps.

reviewText: This game is an unexpected surprise. I consider myself a casual FPS gamer; I don't require games to be too involved to be fulfilled. This game falls perfectly in that scenario for me; single player, guns, health, keys, switches monsters.. done! It's almost old school gaming style which is a succesful formula that is sometimes blown way out of proportion for the gamers who need to be inundated with stimuli. So far, dead effect has enough creatures to keep me fulfilled and challenged. I find the environments to be crisp, fluid, emmersive and love the overall ambience. I've been playing games for many, many years and the aiming functionality in this ranks very high in my book.

Buy it! You will have fun.

reviewText: In the start of the game you get the feeling that this game is going to be a good one. The graphics are pretty nice and the flow of the control and movement feels nice, except the character moves way too slow and can not jump. After three missions, I believe it was, you are in an elevator room about to exit with hordes of these zombies coming for you and no matter what you do, they seem impossible to beat. You wind up dying lots, and lots of times as a result. Yes you can use grenades but there are so many of these things coming at you that you wont have enough, and you will have to rely on a lot of head shooting, which is not that hard, but the problem is the floor crawlers. They are hard to hit. The sheer number of zombies that the devs throw at you in this seemingly very early level of the game has made me so frustrated with this game that I stopped playing it. Seriously, to make a game this difficuolt so early in the game is a sure fire game killer for me. There is no reason to expect a player, after 3 or 4 levels, to be an expert and be able to wipe out an army of zombies while you are merely trying to make it to some other room outside the room you are in. If you try and go around them, your character simply collides with them and u are stuck getting your asssss wipped. This game started off nice but I can see it is a bomb after 3 short levels. If you want to waste your money and buy it, by all means do so but remember who was the one who warned you against this garbage.  Even at a small price of $5.00 it is a dud and a serious aggravator. Good luck.

reviewText:
Doom 3  -   If Doom 3 were made by high school students.

And yet ....  It's fun.   The shooting is clunky,  the enemies are clunky,  the story is non existent, but you almost won't care.   There is a shop system in between missions that lets you spend the currency you collect.  It's all very reminiscent of Dead Space,  and it serves to further reinforce this feeling that there isn't a single original bone in the game's body.   But for 5 dollars you could do a lot worse on Steam.   Especially when you consider the deluge of ♥♥♥♥♥♥ Early access games which are currently asking for a lot more, and offering a lot less.

I feel like this game's heart is in the right place. If you're a fan of old school shooters and you can overlook some rough edges this is worth a look.

reviewText: This game costs three and a half quid (it's bloody cheap). That shouldn't be ignored. It is fun, challenging, much longer than I was expecting and three times better than the iOs version i played beforehand. The tablets are great, you pick them up around the map and they give you extra story that Arnie/Wagner dosen't. His accent is hilarious by the way. The only problem is the guns are way too cheap. the upgrades are progressively expensive and really drain your cash, but the actual weapons are super cheap. After spending no money for the first three levels I could afford the crossbow, which kills the final boss in 3 shots and clears rooms of zombies at a time (just a tad OP). Your gold carries over when you start again on that character slot, which is nice if you buy the best assault rifle after 3 levels then decide that you prefer the stock shotgun... Anyway this game is cheap, fun, has no microtransactions and most of these first negative reviews are just whiny arses who can't get past minibosses (also, shooting grenade zombies in the grenade belt detonates them, the grenade zombies around them and everything in the room. just a tip.) Would definitely recommend.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I really enjoyed playing this game.  I enjoyed the gameplay, loved the atmosphere and found the voice acting very  amusing.

Is it perfect?  No.  But it was a lot of fun and kept me entertained for the full 5.3 hours it took me to get through it.  I will be playing through it again and will also be buying Dead Effect 2 when it comes out.  $4.99 well spent.  Thank you for your work and effort with this.

On a (long) side note:

I've been reading some of the negative reviews here and just want to ask people what exactly they expected to see for the $$ they spent on this.

It's not a multiplayer game and isn't listed that way - so stop saying you only like multiplayer games - no one cares.  If you only enjoy multiplayer,  just buy games that are.

Some complained that it was too claustrophobic.  News flash...spaceships ARE close-quartered areas - just watch some of the YouTube videos of actual interiors.  You can almost ALWAYS find your way out of a sticky situation in this game if you use your head.  Granted, I did wish sometimes that I had the ability to jump over obstacles...but oh, well - just have to play a little differently and not get myself into situations where I would need to do so if I wanted to more easily escape a corner I've backed myself.

And please stop comparing these indie titles to big budget studio games - that's just ridiculous.  So it's reminiscent of Doom, Dead Space or whatever other game you think it looks like - so what.  Unless, of course, you yourself have created a game that's unique and innovative and has never seen before?  There are plenty of big budget games out there that are also very similar in look and gameplay - so get over it.

Constructive criticism is always good - harsh, smart*** criticism, while sometimes amusing, is just a waste of time and it's  only redeeming value is in making the reviewer look completely foolish.

reviewText:
Dead Space is a fine game.
Not especially good, nor especially bad.
I finished the game and took the time to do most of the survival and challenge modes, so here's my pros and cons:
Pros:
Graphics are great
Sounds are great as well
Gameplay? Good assortment of weapons you can continuously upgrade with credits you earn from playing the story, or special missions.
Secrets! Secret signs you can shoot in various rooms of every level unlocks story lore, enemy concept art, and more.    In-Game, there are logs you can pick up to further the lore of the game without being intrusive on the immersion, like Dead Space.
Cons!
Like many people have said, there's a few outstanding problems that can ruin the immersion.
1.Flashlight: Yes it runs out of battery and needs to be recharged. You hardly need the flashlight for the most part, as most rooms are adequately lit.
2.Pathing: Sometimes the arrow points you into a wall; however, most of the time this means you go up through an elevator. Some games don't want to hold your hand through it; what's wrong with that?
3.Enemies: The grenade-throwing zombie: When you get one-shotted by it yes it feels cheap...unless you realize that you can either A: Upgrade your character's health to be able to withstand a point-blank hit or B: Enter bullet time and casually evade it. It's not a question of cheapness; it's about using the skills the game gave you to evade the grenade.
4.Items: Enemies drop glowing gold bars, money, ammo. The look of the drops isn't very consistent with the environment and sticks out, contrasting to Dead Space's drops which do. However, at five dollars, are you really expecting super-high quality? You get what you pay for.

All in all, if you're bored but you like FPS zombie space games and this is on sale, might as well get it. At full price, five dollars is still pretty cheap.

reviewText:
A very good game. Graphics are likeable, plot is not that silly after all, single player campaign is a bit short, but there are additional modes like Survival, Biohazard (kill X enemy waves) and you can repeat single missions.

Interesting things - at later levels you can upgrade your suit through several upgrade stations (1 point each). Interesting enough, those points are permanent - you get the advantage in all game modes.

Guns are nice, minigun is probably the best one. There is a small hole in the desing (I think) - basically when you have upgraded your suit a bit and improved your main weapon to the point that it can shoot and reload fast, then you can repeatedly do first biohazard mission for cash and gold and thus in about an hour you can afford like most of weapons that are available.

There is also a New Game Plus or whatever it's called - basically, a new game on a bit higher difficulty, where you have all you've got in a previous playthrough.

I do recommend this shooter, it's very good, pace is great, tons of fun.

___

One guy noticed that one type of enemy took all of his fun from this game. Well, soldiers with grenades are a bit pain in the back, but still this a shooter where player should react quickly. But after all - you can upgrade your health and after one or two upgrades you can withstand one grenade. Also try to save gold for autohealing, it really helps.

reviewText:
I got this from a bundle and it turns out to be pretty OK.
The controls are a little bit odd (no jumping), but you don't really need any jumping.
Some reviewers criticize the voice acting, but I really love it. The Arnold Schwarzenegger voice Imitation is very entertaining.

The zombie killing is a little bit repetitive, but you get tons of ammunition. You can just go on rampage with your assault rifle in full auto.
Enemy KI is very stupid, but what else would you expect from zombies. You can basically run around a razor and he won't be able to attack you.
The story is ok, but very generic and predictable.

The graphics are OK and the lighting is very well made (except explosions), but the animations aren't very good. I could sometimes count the animation frames while watching a zombie crawling on the floor.

The level design is sometimes a little bit weird because the player will find some rooms that serve no purpose, but I guess that the level designers needed some additional rooms to store the zombies.

The sound effects and music are good, but the music loops are pretty short. It creates a good zombie apocalypse space ship athmosphere.

If you like Arnold Schwarzenegger's accent and killing zombie hordes then you should try this game out.

reviewText:
It was fairly entertaining. For a total of the 4 hours I spent playing this game.
Once you've played Biohazard and Survival, the story is irrelevant and pointless to play.
Pros and Cons time.
Pros:
-Good graphics
-Nice weapon design
-Fairly decent soundtrack
Cons:
-Very limited amount of weapons in your loadout. 2.
-Could have way better voice acting
-Has WAY too many enemies in one room. There's like a hundred in a small room, and a thousand in slightly bigger rooms.
-Often repetitive gameplay, such as rushing into a room with enemies in it. Read the previous con for details.
-Has enemies in literally every room you enter, which makes no sense in any way.
-Stolen sounds, an example is the SPAS-12 (forgot the name of this in the game) sounds. They're stolen from the shotgun from Halo.
-Complicated weapon names. This is bad because you forget the names, and you get these random upgrades and you have no idea whether to be happy or disappointed.
-Promises a lot of gore. Which it lacks.

The Cons list goes on for a while so I'll stop it here.
But their tactic for sales was a cheap one. Not too long before this game came out, the Doom reboot was confirmed. This got people excited for getting a game that you go around and destroy everything in. But they had to wait so long, so what these guys did was ripped off the old ones and mixed a bit of Doom 3 in there, and added new graphics. Therefore people would buy it constantly because they would need something to fill the Doom gap. Little did they know, it was not entertaining after a while. Short storyline compared to the one of Doom, especially in terms of time. Think about it, this game doesnt even have a 5 hour campaign, and Doom has a 13 hour one. This game has no multiplayer which makes it even less playable. Doom's got one where you can even create modes rather than be restricted to certain ones. And enemy creativity? Doom passes this by thousands of miles. Just think, it just so happens that theres chainsaw wielding zombies like in Doom 3, and shirtless fat zombies which are, again, from Doom 3.

reviewText: I say this with genuine affection: Dead Effect" is basically a schlockier version of "Doom 3."  Like D3
date: it takes place on a space station that has been overrun with Space Zombies. You
hoursPlayed: must stop them with your Space Guns and Space Grenades. There is much KERPLOWing and KERPLOOPing as zombie parts fly
voteText: and explosive things go KABOOM. Along the way
helpfulPercent: you pick up PDAs which tell the story of the Dumb Scientists who started the whole mess. Eventually you face off against The Big Bad Guy
votesHelpful: and then... it just kinda ends.\n\nThe main difference between "Dead Effect" and D3 (other than the former's much shorter runtime) is the nature of the combat. In D3
votesTotal: you were faced with a steady trickle of monsters that would pop out of nowhere and attack from a distance with pistols
votesFunny: fireballs
commentsCount: etc. By contrast
column16:
"Dead Effect" basically repeats one combat scenario over and over again:

1. You open a door
2. You see a group of 20 slow-moving zombies start shuffling toward you
3. You pick out the one zombie holding a grenade and shoot him first (optional
column17: but recommended)\n4. You walk backwards and pump shotgun blasts at the rest as they stumble uselessly in your direction
column18:
since they aren't capable of ranged attacks
5. You celebrate victory

I'm really not exaggerating; that's pretty much the whole game. Personally
column19: I found this to be quite fun in a mindless B-movie kind of way. But I could see how others could hate it with full justification.\n\nTL;DR: it's a boilerplate zombie shooter in space with repetitive combat. I found it to be oddly charming and competently made
column20: and perfectly satisfactory as cheap fun. Others may (and do) hate it
column21: and I don't begrudge them that. To each their own."
column22: December 18, 2015

reviewText:
I bought this for £1.15 in the May time sale 2015. It's only 6.1 hours game time for me.

Yet I would have been happy had I paid the full price of £4. Thats's because from the start, DE takes off like a tuned up Doom 3 and it never lets go.

The graphics are great even though there is not enough AA to calm them down. It leaves us with plenty of dazzling lines about. However for the price and the intense fun DE delivers, it doesn't matter for a fraction of a second. With DE you simply get stuck in and have a blast.

The switching weapons to upgrade menu had me confused. Only by the end of the game I guessed it was mouse wheel scroll to select which weapon to upgrade. Bad point that because I tried every key and mouse click. I still managed very well in the game though because it was set to default upgrade the shotgun - good weapon.

If you think not being able to jump is a deal breaker, this is not for you. Personally I forgave it instantly, the moment I found I could exit open elevators before they got right down. The only other aspect to mention about the mechanics, is that the shooting is good.

DE is solid. The biggest surprise is that it's quite scary, and extremely engaging. From the Steam screenshots it looks the opposite, and only questionably worth £4. I just finished it, and even at 6 hours long it feels highly replayable. DE to me was worth every minute and pound invested.

reviewText:
Dead Effect is BadFly Interactive's first game. As such, I think a little slack is deserved. It was designed by a small team with a focus on mobile functionality. As such, the gameplay is a little stiff and knunky. However, it's easy to get used to with a little practice.

Dead Effect's campaign is rather short, but features new game+ and time and wave based survival modes to supplement that. You take on the role of a male or female super soldier trying to figure out why everything on your space ship went to hell while you took a cryo-nap. Helping you along this journey is the only other survivor you know of, Dr. Wagner. The basic plot is reletively predictable, but is a bucket of fun either way. Especially with the wide variety of weapons at your disposal.

Dead Effect was supposed to feature a co-op mode, however, BadFly bit of more than they could chew with that feature and the idea has since been scrapped for Dead Effect. An honest mistake that has been apologized for a number of times already. Dead Effect 2 is in the works and co-op is being kept in mind for debut.

All in all for the developer's first game, it's a bit rough around the edges, but more than worth the $5 price tag.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
I'm honestly surprised by how many positive reviews this game is getting. I just finished it and it's not good. At all.

First and foremost, this is a port of a mobile game that was originally designed to have microtransactions in it. The port is not great. On my GTX970, the frame rate frequently drops when there are a lot of enemies around. The sound is also improperly mixed, with the music overpowering all the speech and the volume sliders literally don't work. The graphics are B-grade but this is an inexpensive game and considering the price, they look decent with strong colours and nice lighting. This actually would look pretty impressive on a mobile device.

The microtransactions have been removed but the secondary gold" currency which is used to buy better weapons and an optional automatic healing device is still present
date: gold it just randomly dropped from enemies now. It's not obnoxious but it feels like a shoehorned design.\n\nThe rest of the game is pretty awful. The voice acting are firmly in the "so bad it's kind of good" camp which I actually can respect when it's done well but the story and writing are absolutely abysmal and the ending is literally a screen of text thanking you for beating the game and saying more is coming soon. The combat feels pretty good with a varied selection of weapons but upgrades require so much in-game currency that you'll probably just focus on one or two
recommended: made more necessary by the bias towards certain types of ammo drops. The enemies run the gamut of usual zombie varieties but some of them (such as the soldiers that throw grenades) are cheaply placed in levels so that you'll frequently die unexpectedly. Since respawning costs in-game money
hoursPlayed: this is really frustrating.\n\nThere was potential for this to be a good B-grade shooter which can still be fun but this was clearly a mobile game first and it didn't make the transition well. This might have been decent by the traditionally low standards most mobile gamers have but on PC
voteText: you can find so many better shooters for similar money. Skip this
helpfulPercent: it's not worth it."

reviewText:
I'm honestly surprised by how many positive reviews this game is getting. I just finished it and it's not good. At all.

First and foremost, this is a port of a mobile game that was originally designed to have microtransactions in it. The port is not great. On my GTX970, the frame rate frequently drops when there are a lot of enemies around. The sound is also improperly mixed, with the music overpowering all the speech and the volume sliders literally don't work. The graphics are B-grade but this is an inexpensive game and considering the price, they look decent with strong colours and nice lighting. This actually would look pretty impressive on a mobile device.

The microtransactions have been removed but the secondary gold" currency which is used to buy better weapons and an optional automatic healing device is still present
date: gold it just randomly dropped from enemies now. It's not obnoxious but it feels like a shoehorned design.\n\nThe rest of the game is pretty awful. The voice acting are firmly in the "so bad it's kind of good" camp which I actually can respect when it's done well but the story and writing are absolutely abysmal and the ending is literally a screen of text thanking you for beating the game and saying more is coming soon. The combat feels pretty good with a varied selection of weapons but upgrades require so much in-game currency that you'll probably just focus on one or two
recommended: made more necessary by the bias towards certain types of ammo drops. The enemies run the gamut of usual zombie varieties but some of them (such as the soldiers that throw grenades) are cheaply placed in levels so that you'll frequently die unexpectedly. Since respawning costs in-game money
hoursPlayed: this is really frustrating.\n\nThere was potential for this to be a good B-grade shooter which can still be fun but this was clearly a mobile game first and it didn't make the transition well. This might have been decent by the traditionally low standards most mobile gamers have but on PC
voteText: you can find so many better shooters for similar money. Skip this
helpfulPercent: it's not worth it."

reviewText:
So far, what I've experienced while playing this for over an hour, I like.

This seems to be a low budget game, developed by people that worked hard to overcome the lack of budget, by making it very solid in terms of play, with a real nice look. The weapon upgade system is full of options. I've paid $50.00 first person shooters that I was far less impressed with.

The price to quality rate makes this game well worth it, if you're looking for a budget FPS.

The guys that developed this deserve some credit for their work.

reviewText:
Wow what a great indie game this is.Think Doom 3 crossed with dead space with a little painkiller sprinkled on top.This is not a triple AAA title but i payed £3 and was worth every penny.I have read some of the negative reviews about no space to move when a horde of zombies come after you,but for me this is what made it fun and tense and made the head-shot all the more important.

My only gripe is that the weapons cost to much to buy and would be a grind to purchase , i made do with the basic pistol and machine gun.

All in all i recommend this fun indie FPS and should be worth your time if you liked any of the games mentioned above.

reviewText:
A competent if unoriginal zombie shooter.

On the plus side:
- Good Score
- Good graphics
- Nice variety in characteristics and behavior among different types of zombies.
- Intuitive controls and upgrade system.

On the minus side:
- Voice acting so bad it almost qualifies as a plus for serving as unintentional comic relief.
- The grenade zombies and their one-hit kills are beyond annoying.

Verdict:
Recommended for a buy if it's on sale.
voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText: I say this with genuine affection: Dead Effect" is basically a schlockier version of "Doom 3."  Like D3
date: it takes place on a space station that has been overrun with Space Zombies. You
hoursPlayed: must stop them with your Space Guns and Space Grenades. There is much KERPLOWing and KERPLOOPing as zombie parts fly
voteText: and explosive things go KABOOM. Along the way
helpfulPercent: you pick up PDAs which tell the story of the Dumb Scientists who started the whole mess. Eventually you face off against The Big Bad Guy
votesHelpful: and then... it just kinda ends.\n\nThe main difference between "Dead Effect" and D3 (other than the former's much shorter runtime) is the nature of the combat. In D3
votesTotal: you were faced with a steady trickle of monsters that would pop out of nowhere and attack from a distance with pistols
votesFunny: fireballs
commentsCount: etc. By contrast
column16:
"Dead Effect" basically repeats one combat scenario over and over again:

1. You open a door
2. You see a group of 20 slow-moving zombies start shuffling toward you
3. You pick out the one zombie holding a grenade and shoot him first (optional
column17: but recommended)\n4. You walk backwards and pump shotgun blasts at the rest as they stumble uselessly in your direction
column18:
since they aren't capable of ranged attacks
5. You celebrate victory

I'm really not exaggerating; that's pretty much the whole game. Personally
column19: I found this to be quite fun in a mindless B-movie kind of way. But I could see how others could hate it with full justification.\n\nTL;DR: it's a boilerplate zombie shooter in space with repetitive combat. I found it to be oddly charming and competently made
column20: and perfectly satisfactory as cheap fun. Others may (and do) hate it
column21: and I don't begrudge them that. To each their own."
column22: December 18, 2015

reviewText: Wow! I played the mobile version, and liked it back then, but this is a super upgrade when it comes to graphics and ambiance. The game is now perfect! It’s a space zombie shooter with doom 3 like graphics. The story is simple, the gaming mechanics are similar to other shooters, but what really makes this game special is the ambiance, really dark, scary ♥♥♥ zombies, and great dynamic shadows & lightning. The combination of the elements used to make this helps to create a nightmarish & enjoyable game. I really thinks this developer is doing a great job in porting this great mobile classic to PC with sweet new graphics. I can’t lie, this is a really good looking pc game, but it certainly isn’t trying to compete with games like DOOM 4, but it definitely seems very worthy of paying for such a great experience.

reviewText: Great game! Too bad it feels like it was made in FPS Creator, but good it was made by someone who knew what they were doing. Having once owned FPS Creator, I recognize the bugs, such as the infamous tripped on a flat floor bug, the lag in highly populated areas, etc. Also recognize the zombie, weapons, and model packs. Not saying for sure it was, because optimizations seemed better, and scripting seems much better. Great work though with lighting, music, sound, and level design is pretty top-notch. Only thing I didn't like, so far, where are the barrels I can shoot and blow up the massive hordes of zombies this game has? Ack! Seriously this game is kind of hard on easy mode. Love it though. Despite other reviews, I like the computer voice...she's personable! It's the Russian guy who can't decide if he has a German accent or an Awnald accent....but it's not terrible by any means. Wish I was good at this game! Oh and I also wish there was a SAVE GAME feature...pretty standard stuff, but that's none of my business.\n\n10/10 Would buy GameGuru and make a sequel.

reviewText:
it's an ok game, I mean it's no L4D or Killing Floor but it's ok, it's really, really, really ok, it is neither good or bad it's just......ok

there is no doubt that this is another typical, mindless, zombie shooter but to be honest that's what I kind of like, I just want to shoot ♥♥♥♥, the game does remind me a little more of Doom 3, and that's not a bad thing, go around kill zombie creatures, collect tablets (helps to know the story, yes it has a story), you're in space, inside a spaceship...

although in Doom they are demons and not just zombies but very comparable in alot of ways, played for two rounds and I gotta say, I'm a little hooked, the graphics are.......meh....but not bad either, it is kind of satisfying getting headshots especially with a shotgun, man does that feel good, and the game runs very smoothly, supposedly this is running on the source engine which explains alot, the voice acting, WOW, it's pretty damn bad

would I recommend this?.....well, depends on the type of person you are, if you just want to pick up and play and kill ♥♥♥♥, then this game is for you....

reviewText: Bought this game for a dollar and change and I honestly would have had no issue spending the full 5. Its a fun game where you go through these levels and kill zombies. Each level takes anywhere from 10-15 minutes on the normal difficulty. There are no microtransactions which is good! At first when I played the game I was thrown off that there was no jumping but over time I got used to it. Also the sprinting is more of thing you use to escape tight spots, not to use to really get around. Guns are not stupidly expensive and the levels arent insanely tough. Its really just a casual fun singleplayer zombie shooter. Put on some heavy music and rip ♥♥♥♥ up !\n\nIf I HAD to compare this to any other zombie game ive played I would have to say it reminds me a bit of killing floor.

reviewText: For a game that is rated mostly positive"
date: I wonder if people rating this game have ever played other sci-fi space FPS games
recommended:
namely DOOM and Dead Space to name a few. This genre has already been successfully attempted and mastered and this game brings very little to the table. You simply cannot contribute to a genre where AAA games will outdo you with graphics or gameplay.

Upon reading the reviews it is a total joke that over 1k people rated this game positively.


I bought this game for 1.35$ with leftover change in my steam account and I think I got what i paid for.

The interface sucks and is boring.

The game's engine looks dated and uninspiring. The gun models look flat and you start off coming out of a cryotube with arms outstretched. Who walks like that?

The zombies move in the same repetitive fashion. Feeling crowded? Simply run past them. It's that easy. The AI is beyond lame.

The music is alright and suits the ambience but the gameplay makes this game dead on arrival.

The controls are awkward and clunky. THERE IS NO JUMP KEY. Let's consider this for a second
hoursPlayed:
shall we?

You are on a space ship in the dead of space. There are hostile undead roving hordes of dead roaming the ship.
There is cargo everywhere. You are running from one corridor to the next. Jumping and being able to jump would seem to the logical conclusion
voteText: especially when you encounter a crate in front of you. But in this game you cannot jump. There is no key map available for it. So if you are surrounded by zombies and death is imminent
helpfulPercent: if you slowly back into a crate measuring a foot in height you simply cannot jump this crate and will be mercilessly slaughtered.\n\nYour epitath will read
votesHelpful: "Here lies John
votesTotal: in the vacuum of space on some cargo ship
votesFunny:
DEAD and in pieces because he was unable to jump".


Worth all 135 pennies I paid."

reviewText: There is lots of reasons i would recommend this game for a hardcore gamers or even casual gamers. This game is decent at best it has no issues i can run it fine at max settings. Its a fun game it has its flaws like for example there isnt very much features really... You find credits in stages through out the game and you buy weapons, upgrades,ammo, and basically everything you would really need to fight an invasion of zombies. This game doesnt really have the best story its a nice story driven game from a indie dev though with somewhat exciting parts through out the game.  Is it worth 5$ yes its a nice decent single player game not the longest game its about 5hrs long and im sure you could beat it in 2 or 3 hours if you really tried. Like i said though its a nice devloped game wroks fine but with little to no cons. My final verdict on the game is if your looking for a nice short single player game buy dead effect. I give the game an 8.5/10 :D

reviewText: Feels like an iOs game rather than an actual game altogether (which it turns out it was before being made into a PC game). I'm sure it's much more fun on a tablet or something, but it's just fairly boring. As it was designed for touchscreens, there isn't much in the way of interesting mechanics. For the most part you just stand in one spot and shoot until everything is dead. It's fine. It's not dreadful, but if I had bought this at full price (got it in a bundle) I would get a refund straight away.

reviewText:
Got this today in the steam sale.  Dont be put off by the cheap price... £1.79 !!  thats rediculous !!  Played for 7hrs non stop and loved it, great atmosphere and the girlfriend made me jump when she got in i was so engrossed :)
Stopped playing to pop out and get a burger..   that cost me more than the game lol.
Ive spent a lot more on other games and not had so much fun.

It reminded me of a Doom / Aliens fest.  Just played on Medium setting and the zombies arnt so bad..   lots of em but thats good and there is plenty of ammo for ya splatter fest !!  Gonna do a play through with the basic weapons cos they are just a lot of fun and then try some of the other weapons.
Just wanted something to pass the evening with but ive a feeling i'll be playing this a lot more.
Simple fun & crazy value in the sale,
9/10  I would shoot the zombies again :)

Edit: Finnished the story line on Medium..  swapped up to Hard & Still loving it.
Going to bed at 12..   $h*t its 12 already..  gonna go at 1..  God dammit its 2 already..  must get sleep!  Just one more go at this lvl  as I need more cash to Upgrade weapons lol <rinse and repeat each night>..    Great game to play in the dark!!  Simplle atmospheric zombie blood bath shoot em up..  cheap as chips and great fun :D
